Pizzeria.title: Pizzeria
Pizzeria.description: Represents a pizzeria in Hermosillo, Sonora.

lat.description: The latitude coordinate of the pizzeria's location.

lng.description: The longitude coordinate of the pizzeria's location.

source.description: The source of the pizzeria's information (e.g., 'OpenStreetMap', 'HERE WeGo').

rating.description: The average rating of the pizzeria.

User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Hermosillo Pizza Finder app.

isAdmin.description: Indicates whether the user is an administrator.

Review.title: Review
Review.description: Represents a review of a pizzeria by a user.

rating.description: The rating given by the user (e.g., 1 to 5 stars).

comment.description: The user's comment about the pizzeria.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the review was created.

Testimonial.title: Testimonial
Testimonial.description: Represents a user testimonial about the PizzApp application.

author.description: The name of the user giving the testimonial.

email.description: The user's email, used for avatar generation.

role.description: A description of the user, e.g., 'Amante de la Pizza'.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the testimonial was created.

reply.description: An administrator's reply to the testimonial.

repliedAt.description: The timestamp when the reply was created.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore data structure is designed to support the Hermosillo Pizza Finder app, focusing on security, scalability, and ease of maintenance. The structure leverages path-based ownership for user-specific data. Authorization independence is achieved by denormalizing relevant authorization data (isAdmin flag) into the user profile, eliminating the need for costly and complex `get()` or `exists()` calls in security rules.

The segregation strategy ensures each collection contains documents with uniform security requirements, simplifying the rule base and improving query performance.

*   `/users/{userId}`: Stores user profiles. This collection uses path-based ownership. The `isAdmin` flag on this document is the source of truth for admin privileges.
*   `/pizzerias/{pizzeriaId}`:  Stores information about each pizzeria. Any authenticated user can read the pizzeria data, only admins can create/update/delete them.
*   `/pizzerias/{pizzeriaId}/reviews/{reviewId}`: Stores reviews for each pizzeria. Uses path-based ownership from the pizzeria to the review, with admins having moderation rights.
*   `/testimonials/{testimonialId}`: Stores user testimonials about the app. These are publicly readable and can be created by any authenticated user, but only managed by admins.
